unnormalised: A disturbing incident unfolded in Karol Bagh y'day, with Delhi Police arresting one Rakesh Kumar, s/o Suresh Kumar, under IPC Section 307. The FIR states he allegedly assaulted his neighbour with a cricket bat following a heated argument over parking space. Eye witnesses claim the altercation escalated quickly around 8 PM.
normalised: A disturbing incident unfolded in Karol Bagh yesterday, with Delhi Police arresting one Rakesh Kumar, son of Suresh Kumar, under I-P-C Section three hundred and seven. The F-I-R states he allegedly assaulted his neighbor with a cricket bat following a heated argument over parking space. Eye witnesses claim the altercation escalated quickly around eight P-M.

unnormalised: Kumar has been remanded to judicial custody for 14 days. Adv. Mehra, representing the victim, stated the attack was pre-meditated, citing CCTV footage showing Kumar allegedly preparing the bat beforehand. The case is scheduled for a hearing on 15/07/2024 at Tis Hazari Court.
normalised: Kumar has been remanded to judicial custody for fourteen days. Advocate Mehra, representing the victim, stated the attack was pre-meditated, citing C-C-T-V footage showing Kumar allegedly preparing the bat beforehand. The case is scheduled for a hearing on fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four at Tis Hazari Court.

unnormalised: Legal experts are saying the severity of the injuries will be crucial in determining the final charges. If convicted under Section 307 (attempt to murder), Kumar could face imprisonment of up to 10 yrs. The investigation is ongoing; further details are awaited from DCP North district.
normalised: Legal experts are saying the severity of the injuries will be crucial in determining the final charges. If convicted under Section three hundred and seven (attempt to murder), Kumar could face imprisonment of up to ten years. The investigation is ongoing; further details are awaited from D-C-P North district.
